div.p: The grace of God be with you all. Amen. I am in great need of it; for little has improved around me, etc.

I thank you for your service, I am sorry about your deceased wine; also, I miss my mountain, etc. Yesterday, after the evening bell, Master Hans Ziegler came to me along with the bailiff; Ziegler said that his father had departed from this world with the same illness (but after a long time).

May the will of God be done with me. Pray to God for me. From now on, I do not wish to take such costly medicine from the apothecary. I will ask God for a doctor. I would like to write more to you; it is not within my ability.
Farewell. Greet the family, whom I earnestly ask to pray to God for me, etc.
To my faithful and dear brother Master Heinrich Bullinger in Zurich.
The very last letter around the beginning of August written by my brother, who died on August 15 around 3 in the afternoon in Kappel 1570.
